intro: Mezzettia parviflora var. subtetramera, commonly known as the small-flowered mezzettia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbels and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing a low-growing, herbaceous habit. Its flowers are small and white, often arranged in clusters, and bloom during the late spring to early summer. The variety subtetramera is distinguished by its four stamens, a feature that sets it apart from other varieties within the species.
